title: Comics + Writing
description: I have been programming for 10 years and teaching classes on the same topic for just as long. My expertise lies within Web Development though I know the fundamentals of Python. I am currently teaching myself React.JS, Node.JS and other associated topics.

projects.title: Tropical Punch
projects.desc: It's a story as old as time. A boy and his dog. A boy and his dog go on a martial-arts road trip so the boy can fight his way back into an ancient clan of warriors. It's all boring, everyday affairs, really. Did I mention the dog was also the boy's chainsmoking teacher? Great stuff
projects.para2: Tropical Punch is an ongoing action/comedy series that began publication in June of 2022. It is drawn by Ryan Ibbotson and written, lettered and produced by myself. It is sold in comic shops around Ireland, online through Gumroad, and at conventions such as the Cork Zine Fest and the Dublin Comic and Arts Fair. It is currently published in individually printed and released issues with a forthcoming collection of the first 4 issues, standing at over 100 pages long. Tropical Punch has built a loyal and local fanbase in Cork City over the course of its run. In particular, each of the first 3 issues sold out upon release, and as a result in late 2022, the entire series was sent back to the printer for a re-printed second-edition run. This second edition publication has also continued to sell well and has ensured the series' longevity going forward.

projects.title: Marco The Demon Dude
projects.desc: What would you do if you got superpowers at 12? Well, when Marco makes a deal with a devil, he gets to find an answer to that question. Superhero. He becomes a superhero. Because of course, he does! If you've got the power to knock bad guys through buildings in your spandex-clad fingertips, why shouldn't you? Who cares about justice, morals or terrorized locals? All you've gotta do is beat the bad guy and Marco The Demon Dude will do whatever it takes... Even if that means blowing up a city in the process.
projects.para2: Marco The Demon Dude was a 4 chapter series that began publication in 2019 and finished serialization in 2022. It was ultimately collected into an 80+ page graphic novel which went on to win 4 Irish Comic News awards in 2022. Including but not limited to 'Overall Best Irish Comic' and allowed me to win 'Best Small Press Writer'. The book was then allowed me to be shortlisted for a Cork 'Rebel Spirit Award from MBC International and the series was featured in the 'Louder Than Words' Junior Cycle English Textbook as an example of Sequential Storytelling.

projects.title: Cork Teen Graphic Novel Project
projects.desc: Simple guessing game made in React. The object of the game is to pick a card and try to find it once it has been reshuffled

projects.title: Saturday AM & Fan Art Fridays
projects.desc: Started as a European Marketing intern and worked my way onto the editing team, helping to manage teams of creatives producing comic books for an international audience of hundreds of thousands. More info in Comic Portfolio.

title: Video Work
description: I have been programming for 10 years and teaching classes on the same topic for just as long. My expertise lies within Web Development though I know the fundamentals of Python. I am currently teaching myself React.JS, Node.JS and other associated topics.

projects.title: Man
projects.desc: Maths Master was an educational maths game developed in vanilla JS based on the popular Pokemon franchise. It has four levels, a high-score system, and multiple player options.

projects.title: React Weather App
projects.desc: Colour changing weather app used to get to grips with the idea of API calls and CSS variables within React

projects.title: React Guessing Game
projects.desc: Simple guessing game made in React. The object of the game is to pick a card and try to find it once it has been reshuffled

projects.title: React To-Do App
projects.desc: I used this project to teach myself the fundamentals of React.JS, including components, state, routing, etc. Note: the viewable version does not allow for viewing cards due to GitHub Permissions
